Html: I keep getting the "conflicting modifications detected" dialog whenever I turn "compile on save". Pressing any of the buttons, "Overwrite", "Discard in-memory changes", or "Help" doesn't help.

Trying to think through this - do you have the JavaScript you're compiling to checked into source control? One time this error might occur is if the version that's checked in is different than the one that you have when you're trying to compile. I believe the latest plugin does try to check out the .js file, but if there's a conflict here, you'd likely see something similar to that message.

No, I don't have the js files in source control.

The typescript compiler seems to use up a lot of memory. Could this be a low memory issue?
